Question.Text: A 34-year-old man from Thailand presents with a 2-week history of fever, weight loss, fatigue/malaise. The patient has a generalized non-pruritic rash, predominantly on his face and trunk, which consists of small umbilicated papules

Answer: Disseminated penicilliosis (Talaromyces marneffei infection) - The patient presents with prolonged fever, weight loss, and characteristic umbilicated papular rash on face and trunk in Thailand, endemic for this AIDS-defining illness. The images show multiple umbilicated skin lesions and intracellular yeast forms with central septation (resembling ping-pong balls) on microscopy, pathognomonic for Talaromyces marneffei.
